text:
Graydon Ausmus -2- Oct. 14, 1954
Specifically answrlng your question about East Lansing
or Ann Arbor. If NAEB is to movem then I think one of these
might be better than many others. Between the two, if the
price of Independence of NAEB Is not involved, I‘d be inclined
to favor East Lansing. If it should bring more involvements
instead of fewer, then I'd be opposed to East Lansing.
On Ann Arbor, the thing in favor of that site would b© the
proximity to the Center. This assumes the Center is to stay
in Ann Arbor. I'm not so sure that is going to happen. But
if it does, then nearness of the two to each other is good.
Personally, I don't like Ann Arbor for geographical
location. Too darned difficult to get to and from, especially
the airport. Also, I thought Center made a mistake In not
picking Champaign-Urbana, or Chicago, but I'm not upset about
it. If the Center wishes to be in AA, or some other spot,
it's o.k. by me. It's interesting to note that the Center
ends up by using Uof I for distribution. Logic seems to be
with me, anyhow.
One other thing, God willing I'll have all the treasurer's
reports ready, audited, reported, duplicated for convention
time. Don't want you to worry about that.
Always good to see you, and especially have you in our
home. The family always enjoys your presence.
Sincerely,
Frank E. Schooiey
